doc.after: At the time of the attacks, approximately 18,000Â people worked in the Pentagon, which was 4,000Â fewer than before renovations began in 1998.[44] The section of the Pentagon, which had recently been renovated at a cost of $250Â million,[45] housed the Naval Command Center[46] and other Pentagon offices, as well as some unoccupied offices. The crash and subsequent fire penetrated three outer ring sections of the western side. The outermost ring section was largely destroyed, and a large section collapsed.
